qas.question: Willett's first suggestion was to change clocks by 20 minutes how often?
What drawback would changing clocks gradually add to the process?
What could be avoided by changing clocks more gradually more often?

context: <a2_0>Some clock-shift problems<a2_0/> could be avoided by adjusting clocks continuously or at least more gradually—for example, Willett at first suggested <a0_0>weekly<a0_0/> 20-minute transitions—but this would add <a1_0>complexity<a1_0/> and has never been implemented.
